page.title: 09Old People in Banbury
page.content: Banbury has two Day Centres for old people.We visited one in Britannia Road - our old infant school. Old people go to Day Centres to make new friends. They can enjoy each others' company and play games like dominoes,cards and scrabble. Sometimes they go on outings. They have been on two recently - one to Warwick and one to Leamington Spa. They have a coffee morning every so often and a pianist comes each Wednesday and they sing along with the piano. The centre is open five days a week,but you are only allowed to go twice. The average age is about 80-85. They can have a meal for 50p- meat, vegetables, potatoes and a pudding. There is also a trolley where they can buy food such as sweets,tinned food,biscuits and toiletry items.
